newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel's Netanyahu to meet Clinton next week.
newsitem.headline: Israel's Netanyahu to meet Clinton next week.

text.p: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will holds talks in the United States with President Bill Clinton next week, the prime minister's office said on Tuesday.
The two leaders will discuss among other things the U.S. sponsored Middle East peace process.
"The prime minister will meet with President Clinton next Monday," Netanyahu's office said in a statement. It did not say where in the United States the meeting would be held.
Netanyahu is expected by Israeli officials to meet Palestinian President Yasser Arafat prior to the trip to the United States.
Intensive contacts are underway between Israeli and Palestinian officials to pave the way for a Netanyahu-Arafat meeting.
Netanyahu, elected in May, has resisted meeting Arafat saying he will do so only when he deems it necessary for the security of the state of Israel.
While in the United States Netanyahu will meet in New York with Jewish leaders, the statement said.
